CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 6, 1956, pg. 2, reads: "An Era Passes - The fabulous Crawford Grill is being reduced to ground level as part of the 'Lower Hill redevelopment program.' The 'Grill' was made famous by Gus Greenlee (the owner), whose investments in baseball's Negro National League, Pittsburgh's Crawfords, East- West Game, Four Club Doubleheaders, boxing's light heavyweight champion John Henry Lewis and other boxers, carried him to all parts of the United States and Europe. - Harris Photo."Originally the building was the Leader Inn, then the C & G Restaurant, and finally it became home to Crawford Grill No. 1.
TitMainTitle: Demolition of Crawford Grill No. 1, with workers on roof, corner of 1401 Wylie Avenue and Townsend Street, Hill District
